The parallelogram bounded by the lines $y=ax+c$, $y=ax+d$, $y=bx+c$, and $y=bx+d$ has area 18. The parallelogram bounded by the lines $y=ax+c$, $y=ax-d$, $y=bx+c$, and $y=bx-d$ has area 72. Given that $a$, $b$, $c$, and $d$ are positive integers, what is the smallest possible value of $a+b+c+d$?

The parallelogram bounded by $y=ax+c$, $y=ax+d$, $y=bx+c$, and $y=bx+d$ has vertices at the intersection points of the lines. The intersection points are where $ax+c = bx+c$ and $ax+d = bx+d$. The first equation gives $ax=bx$, which has the solution $x=0$ or $a=b$. The second equation gives $ax=bx$, which has the solution $x=0$ or $a=b$. Thus, if $a \neq b$, the intersection of $y=ax+c$ and $y=bx+c$ is at $x=0$ and $y=c$. The intersection of $y=ax+d$ and $y=bx+d$ is at $x=0$ and $y=d$. If $a=b$, then the parallelogram has vertices at $(0,c)$, $(0,d)$, $(\frac{d-c}{a-b},d)$ and $(\frac{d-c}{a-b},c)$. Thus, the base is $\frac{d-c}{a-b}$.
The height is $|d-c|$. The area of the parallelogram is given by $\frac{|d-c| \cdot |a-b|}{1} = |d-c|\cdot |a-b| = 18$.
The parallelogram bounded by $y=ax+c$, $y=ax-d$, $y=bx+c$, and $y=bx-d$ has vertices at the intersection points of the lines. The intersection points are at $ax+c=bx+c \implies ax=bx \implies x=0$ and $y=c$, and at $ax+c=bx-d$ giving $ax-bx = -d-c \implies x=\frac{-(c+d)}{a-b}$ and $y = a\left(\frac{-(c+d)}{a-b}\right)+c = \frac{-a(c+d)+c(a-b)}{a-b}$. The intersection of $ax-d = bx-d \implies (a-b)x=0 \implies x=0$ and $y=-d$. Thus, the intersection is at $(0,c)$.
If $a \ne b$, the base is $\frac{-(c+d)}{a-b} - \frac{c+d}{a-b} \times 0 = 2\frac{c+d}{a-b} \times \frac{1}{2}$. The height is $|2d|$.
The area of the parallelogram is $2\frac{|c+d||a-b|}{|a-b|} = 2|c+d| = 72$. Then $|c+d|=36$. Since $c, d$ are positive integers, $c+d=36$. The first area is $|d-c| |a-b| = 18$. So $|d-c| \times |a-b| = 18$.
$|d-c| |a-b| = 18$. $|c+d| |a-b| = 72$. Thus, $|d-c| \cdot |a-b| = 18$ and $2|c+d| = 72$, so $|c+d| = 36$. $c+d=36$.
We have $18 = |d-c||a-b|$ and $72 = 2|c+d|$. $c+d=36$ and $d-c=2$, $a-b=9$. $2c=34$, $c=17$, $d=19$. $a-b=9$, $a=10, b=1$.
$a+b+c+d=10+1+17+19 = 47$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{47}$
